A First Plug-in Action/Dialog sample

Description :
This is a very simple plug-in for DAZ Studio that shows the basics of setting up a DAZ Studio plug-in, inheriting from a DAZ Studio SDK class, and inheriting from a Qt class to add new functionality to DAZ Studio. In this plug-in we create a new menu/toolbar item by subclassing DzAction. We create a dialog by subclassing QDialog. The action displays the dialog with a basic "Hello World" message when the user clicks on the item.
 
Concepts Covered :
  • Making a simple DAZ Studio plug-in
  • Addition of an action item by inheriting DzEditAction
  • Creating a custom dialog by inheriting QDialog
  • Standard DAZ Studio dialog buttons and their placement
  • Implementing the "What's This?" (dynamic help) feature
  • Suggested coding standards and project layout
 
Files : ./sdk/samples/interface/AFirstPlugin

afirstpluginaction.cpp The action class implementation.
afirstplugindlg.h The dialog class header.
afirstplugindlg.cpp The dialog class implementation.
